intro: Elaeagia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Ecuador and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a fragrant scent when crushed. Elaeagia ecuadorensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
